main event: An unidentified object was tracked on radar in Detroit, Michigan on 17 May 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared as a well-defined blip on the radar, comparable in size to a 10 cent piece,Initial sighting showed the object at a distance of approximately 70 nautical miles and speed of about 1250 knots,The object faded from radar after approximately 30 seconds,Was observed by radar operators with over 21 months of experience,Conclusions from the report suggested it was possibly a balloon or aircraft but ruled out confirmed aircraft.
witness description: radar operator and radar sergeant, each with approximately 21 months experience on the radar
